intro: Micromeria flacca, commonly known as the flaccid micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with four petals. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
